verse.roman:
kāścit tat-kṛta-hṛt-tāpa
śvāsa-mlāna-mukha-śriyaḥ
sraṁsad-dukūla-valaya
keśa-granthyaś ca kāścana

synonyms: kāścit—some of them; tat—by that (hearing); kṛta—created; hṛt—in their hearts; tāpa—from the torment; śvāsa—by the sighing; mlāna—made pale; mukha—of their faces; śriyaḥ—the luster; sraṁsat—loosening; dukūla—their dresses; valaya—bracelets; keśa—in their hair; granthyaḥ—the knots; ca—and; kāścana—others.
translation: Some gopīs felt so pained at heart that their faces turned pale from their heavy breathing. Others were so anguished that their dresses, bracelets and braids became loose.
